sentence: Colgate-Palmolive Company ( CL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on April 21, 2015.
A cash dividend payment of $0.38 per share is scheduled to be paid on May 15, 2015.
Shareholders who purchased CL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 5.56% increase over the prior quarter.
At the current stock price of $69.28, the dividend yield is 2.19%.
The previous trading day's last sale of CL was $69.28, representing a -3.19% decrease from the 52 week high of $71.56 and a 10.79% increase over the 52 week low of $62.53.
CL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
CL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.36.
Zacks Investment Research reports CL's forecasted earnings growth in 2015 as 1.51%, compared to an industry average of -2.7%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the CL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
